title: 358. Yes, the Open Office Is Terrible — But It Doesn’t Have to Be
description: It began as a post-war dream for a more collaborative and egalitarian workplace. It has evolved into a nightmare of noise and discomfort. Can the open office be saved, or should we all just be working from home?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: It began as a post-war dream for a more collaborative and egalitarian workplace. It has evolved into a nightmare of noise and discomfort. Can the open office be saved, or should we all just be working from home?
